snippet: Opponents said the program, under which foreigners can pay to buy Maltese citizenship, could open the door to the West for criminals or terrorists.
abstract: Program in Malta that offers citizenship for cash is raising concern among European Union officials who fear it could open a back door into Europe and the United States for swindlers, criminals or terrorists; price tag currently runs up to $1.57 million.
lead_paragraph: Opponents said the program, under which foreigners can pay to buy Maltese citizenship, could open the door to the West for criminals or terrorists.

headline.main: Citizenship-for-Cash Program in Malta Stirs Security Concerns in European Union
headline.print_headline: Citizenship-for-Cash Program in Malta Stirs Security Concerns in European Union
